intro: Xanthocephalum gymnospermoides, commonly known as the hairy bushveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Xanthocephalum gymnospermoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
